conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Liquid flows out from points labeled A, B, and C at the top of the image.
A brown bar is positioned diagonally below point A, blocking direct downward flow.
Liquid from A flows downward and is blocked by the brown bar, then flows right towards the intersection near the center.
A teal bar is positioned diagonally below point B, blocking direct downward flow.
Liquid from B flows downward and is blocked by the teal bar, then flows to the right and joins the flow from A at the central intersection.
An orange bar is positioned diagonally below point C, blocking direct downward flow.
Liquid from C flows downward and is blocked by the orange bar, then flows to the left towards the central intersection where it meets A and B.
The combined liquid flow from A, B, and C collects at the central intersection.
A gap is visible between the white and purple bars below the central intersection.
The combined flow moves downward through the gap between the white and purple bars.
Container D is orange and positioned directly below the gap between the white and purple bars.
The combined flow continues downward and enters the orange container (D).
The liquid flows into container D after passing through the baffles.
Final answer: The liquid will flow into container D.
